channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US government report assesses China intentionally concealed severity of coronavirus
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Sunday stepped up administration claims that China mounted efforts to hide the extent of the coronavirus spread, including concealing the severity while stockpiling medical supplies.

item.title: China pushes back against US claims that coronavirus originated from Wuhan lab
item.description: A nationalist tabloid controlled by the Chinese Communist Party has dismissed claims by the Trump administration that the novel coronavirus originated from a laboratory, as the war of words over the pandemic escalates between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: Trump blames China for outbreak. See how they responded.
item.description: CNN's David Culver reports on how Chinese state media is responding to blame from the US for their coronavirus response.

item.title: Spain begins 'phase 1' lockdown de-escalation measures on 4 islands
A 'travel bubble' between Australia and New Zealand could be a model for the future
item.description: It may be some time before tourists are traveling the globe again. But what if you could travel through designated, approved parts of it?

item.title: Lincoln got better press treatment, Trump claims, as he ups US death estimate
George W. Bush has a message about Covid-19
item.description: Former President George W. Bush called for an end to partisanship in the nation's continued battle against the coronavirus, urging Americans to "remember that empathy and simple kindness are essential powerful tools of national recovery."

item.title: This is how America's largest city deals with its dead
item.description: In his final moments, Ananda Mooliya reassured his wife and two sons that he was fine, though they could hear his labored breathing from the next room, over the sound of the TV.

item.title: The billion-dollar move that Michael Jordan almost missed
item.description: As old sayings go, not many have stood the test of time better than "mother knows best."

item.title: The less obvious running mate Joe Biden should pick
item.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden is right to narrow his vice presidential selection to a woman. After decades of other countries electing women to lead on the global stage, it is time for the United States to get on the right side of history.

item.title: Shops reopened. People getting facials. See Vienna's 'new normal'
item.description: Large shops have opened, hair salons have resumed services and some sports can be played with restrictions. CNN's Lynda Kinkade reports on the next stage of Austria's reopening.

item.title: When your home is an internet cafe, but the pandemic forces you out
item.description: Odd jobs on construction sites used to earn Takahashi enough money to pay for a private booth each night at one of Tokyo's internet cafes. But Japan's coronavirus lockdown not only cost him his work, it has temporarily closed the cafe that was his de facto home.

item.title: Invasive 'murder hornet' spotted in US for first time
item.description: Asian giant hornets have been spotted in the United States for the first time, and at more than two inches long, they're the world's largest hornets with a sting that can kill humans if bitten multiple times, according to experts at the Washington State University. Researches have nicknamed them "murder hornets."

item.title: May the Fourth be with you, always, even during the pandemic
Hear from astronaut on returning to earth amid pandemic
item.description: NASA astronaut Jessica Meir just returned to Earth to find a world now transformed by the coronavirus. Meir shares details about how she is transitioning into a new normal.

item.title: Piers Morgan steps back from TV after developing coronavirus symptom
item.description: British TV host Piers Morgan is taking a break from his role on "Good Morning Britain" while he awaits the results of a Covid-19 test.

item.title: Russia adds record 10,000 coronavirus cases as Putin's problems stack up
item.description: Russia reported 10,633 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, its fourth record single-day increase in a row, in what is becoming a major headache for President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: US stock futures fall as uncertainty around the economy persists
item.description: US stock futures dipped Sunday evening as the country heads into another week of uncertainty, with investors trying to understand the scale of the the economic crisis caused by coronavirus and wondering when the economy will be able to reopen successfully.

item.title: A day in the life of Turkey's contact tracers
item.description: CNN's Arwa Damon follows a group of contact tracers as they try to track down and contain exposure to coronavirus in Turkey.

item.title: Reliance Jio lands another major cash infusion to fuel its digital dominance in India
item.description: India's biggest tech and telecom firm just got a big cash injection from Silver Lake, the US private equity firm with a winning track record of placing big bets on promising tech giants.

item.title: What happens if vaccine is never developed? It has happened before
item.description: As countries lie frozen in lockdown and billions of people lose their livelihoods, public figures are teasing a breakthrough that would mark the end of the crippling coronavirus pandemic: a vaccine.

item.title: The computer virus that cost the world $10 billion
Designing the world's first home computers
item.description: Long before they found their way into living rooms around the world, computers were the preserve of universities, research institutes and corporate headquarters. After all, the blinking, bulky mainframes of the 1960s might easily fill a room of their own.

item.title: What Kim Yo Jong's rise to the top says -- and doesn't say -- about being a woman in North Korea
Trudeau's assault weapons ban doesn't do enough
item.description: It came as close as possible to Canada's Sandy Hook tragedy. On April 18, an unhinged man went on a 13-hour rampage in rural Nova Scotia and killed 22 people, including a veteran Royal Canadian Mounted Police officer. It was the worst mass killing in Canadian history and shocked an already traumatized nation dealing with the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: What went wrong with UK's initial Covid-19 response?
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh looks into the UK's initial response to Covid-19 and how that may have contributed to now having close to the worst death toll in Europe.

item.title: Stelter: Hard times call for hard truths from public officials
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: France reports its lowest daily coronavirus death toll since late March
item.description: France has reported its lowest daily death toll from Covid-19 since March 22.

item.title: Hear from The Guardian's Editor-in-Chief on World Press Freedom Day
item.description: Brian Stelter marks World Press Freedom Day and discusses a recent coronavirus-triggered crackdown on reporting in some countries. Katharine Viner, editor-in-chief of the Guardian newspaper, says "whenever there is a shock to the system, governments will try to use that" to limit access and scrutiny, "unless we keep an eye on them."

item.title: The world is paying a high price for cheap clothes
item.description: When shoppers entered H&M's flagship store in central London last summer, the first thing they would have seen was a dark blue, flowery minidress hanging front and center. On sale for just £4 (or $4.80 US), the dress featured more than a low price tag. It also boasted a green label with the word "CONSCIOUS."

item.title: 'SNL' star portrayed lawmaker in skit. Then, she got this in the mail.
item.description: 'Saturday Night Live' cast member Cecily Strong received a Michigan-themed care package in the mail after she portrayed the state's governor Gretchen Whitmer in a sketch.

item.title: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas join 'I for India' concert to raise money for India's Covid-19 response
item.description: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas, Mick Jagger, Will Smith and Mindy Kaling are among the dozens of musicians and celebrities participating in the "iFor India" fundraiser concert Sunday to benefit coronavirus relief.

item.title: Italy's incredible 'floating ship' bridge reaches for the sky
item.description: High above the Polcevera valley, the final section of a majestic new bridge was hoisted into place this week, signaling the imminent completion of a remarkable engineering project against seemingly impossible odds.

item.title: Billie Jean King says record-chasing Serena Williams should see tennis break as 'positive'
item.description: Just how the legendary older guard of tennis will react when the sport returns will make for interesting viewing.

item.title: Turtles race for their own Kentucky Derby win
item.description: The 2nd ever Turtle Derby race was held in lieu of the 146th Kentucky Derby horse race, which was postponed due to coronavirus.

item.title: Three pole vaulters will compete in their own backyards
item.description: If you can't bring the pole vault to the stadium, bring it to the backyard?

item.title: Queen's 'We Are The Champions' reimagined for health care workers
item.description: Almost everyone knows the lyrics to Queen's "We Are the Champions." Now, the band has turned the song on its head, as a tribute to workers on the frontline fighting coronavirus.

item.title: Watch hilarious talking dog meme about quarantine
item.description: Dog-owners go gaga over their pets while in quarantine. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports they're social but not distancing.

item.title: Photos: With cities on lockdown, animals are finding more room to roam
Rarely seen photos from the Met Gala show celebrities letting loose
item.description: The first Monday of May this year marks an absence in the fashion world. With the cancellation of the Met Gala and the indefinite closure of the Metropolitan Museum of Art due to the coronavirus pandemic, the museum's front steps will remain quiet, empty of the usual crowds of celebrities and fashion insiders who flock to the annual fundraiser for the Costume Institute.

item.title: Tens of thousands of flamingos flock to locked-down Mumbai
item.description: Whilst people in India are in lockdown, tens of thousands of flamingos are making the most of the peace and quiet.

item.title: All that sourdough you've been making could help scientists
item.description: By the end of this pandemic, we'll all have one thing in common -- at some point during our isolation, we attempted to make sourdough.

item.title: Why the pressure to change our faces has never been higher
item.description: For her sprawling history "Face: A Visual Odyssey," designer and author Jessica Helfand assembled a dazzling cabinet of human curiosities. From police mugshots and dating-site selfies, to politicians' headshots, Victorian death portraits and rubberised sex-dolls -- all to grapple with the way our faces have been presented and judged over the centuries -- and the lengths we've gone to, to "improve" them.

item.title: US death toll could rise to 90,000
Lincoln got better press treatment, Trump claims, as he ups pandemic death estimate
item.description: After admitting US coronavirus deaths could hit 90,000, President Donald Trump is bemoaning his own plight -- complaining that he has been treated worse by the press than Abraham Lincoln.

item.title: Fact check: Trump peppers Fox News town hall with false claims on coronavirus
item.description: President Donald Trump delivered another rapid series of false and misleading claims on Sunday night, this time at a Fox News "virtual town hall" event at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, DC.

item.title: Trump says intelligence officials didn't raise virus until late January
item.description: President Donald Trump claimed Sunday that the US intelligence community "did NOT bring up the CoronaVirus subject matter until late into January" and that "they only spoke of the Virus in a very non-threatening, or matter of fact, manner."

item.title: Pence says he should have worn a mask
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence said Sunday that he should have worn a mask during his visit to the Mayo Clinic last week when he toured the renowned medical facility without one despite their policy requiring it.

item.title: How Trump has broken the polls
item.description: Poll of the week: A new Ipsos/Reuters poll finds that former Vice President Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump by a 45% to 39% margin.
